title: Us citizen wants to bring sick grandmother to the US
question: Hello, I am a 25 year old US citizen born and raised in los angeles california. My grandmother is 83 years old and a diabetic living in tijuana. What I would like to know is how can I bring her to the US not permanent but where i can bring her here every so often
answers:
Unfortunately, you cannot bring your grandmother to the US with an I-130 (family-based petition) because she does not fit into any of the preference categories or qualify as an immediate relative. The best that I can think of for her to enter the US is with a medical visa, which is very similar to the tourist visa. You can learn more about the process here: www.uscis.gov.

This correspondence is intended as general information and not as legal advice. Please speak to an experienced immigration attorney for assistance.

I will agree with the previous lawyer. You will want to look into a humanitarian parole. Talk to a good lawyer to help.
